intro: Lotus michauxianus, commonly known as the Michaux's lotus, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy pink or purple flowers. The plant produces pods that contain several round, smooth seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
